name: Sentiment Masking in Analysis
description: Distinguishes product sentiment from defect facts
notes: Goal: ensure positive/negative wording does not sway defect detection when sentiment is masked.

theory.natural_language: Quality analysis masks sentiment. Statement: 'The amazing new release of AppX crashes on login' contains positive sentiment but reports a defect. Another statement: 'The horrible AppX crashes on login' is negative but same fact. Sentiment must not change the crash fact.

queries.natural_language: Is it factual that AppX crashes on login regardless of sentiment?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. The crash fact is independent of sentiment.
expected_answer.explanation: qa_analysis MASKS sentiment âˆ§ AppX CRASHES_ON login

queries.natural_language: Does positive wording make the crash less true?

expected_answer.natural_language: No. Sentiment is masked for factual analysis.
